using the reply function To be removed from our mailing list see instructions at the bottom of this message Dear UT Alumni and Friends There are two funding issues before the Texas Legislature that are of critical importance to The University of Texas at Austin and all of higher education These issues are Increasing university tuition rates by a semester credit hour each year through the academic year and Retaining of indirect cost funding earned on research awards and contracts WE NEED YOU TO CONTACT LEGISLATORS TO VOICE YOUR SUPPORT FOR THESE MEASURES Unless these two issues are passed by the Legislature UT Austin risks being less competitive with its peer institutions for faculty and research dollars and will lose the momentum that resulted from the investment made in higher education for the last two legislative sessions INCREASING TUITION Senate Bill by Senator Teel Bivins and House Bill by Representative Rob Junell would authorize a a semester credit hour increase in tuition rates each year through the academic year The House bill also increases tuition by a semester credit hour for each of the following five years We do not know which bill will move first However one of these bills should be before the full Senate or House soon Please call your State Senator and Representative and other members you know and say I support SB and HB the bills to increase tuition rates at universities and urge you to vote for this legislation when it reaches the SenateHouse floor Phone numbers available at rSenatesenmemhtm and housememberhtm or copy this address into the locationaddress field of your browser Reasons to support the bill include Texas ranks nd among the states in total tuition and fees paid to comprehensive colleges and universities Tuition is a necessary part of the financing for university operations since general revenue provides only a portion of state appropriated funds The first year revenue gain from the tuition increase for all universities would be about million Of that amount over million would flow to UT System universities Fifteen percent of the tuition increase is devoted automatically to student financial aid RETENTION OF OF INDIRECT COST FUNDING Senate Bill the State budget bill uses of the indirect cost funds earned by a university on research awards and contracts to offset university appropriations The Conference Committee on SB may consider allowing universities to retain up to of these funds Please call members of the Conference Committee on SB and say I support allowing universities to retain of indirect cost funds earned on research grants and contracts and urge you to make that change in the Appropriations Bill SB The Senators and Representatives on the Conference Committee are Senators Rodney Ellis Robert Duncan Chris Harris Steve Ogden and Judith Zaffirini and Representatives Rob Junell Garnet Coleman Pete Gallego Talmadge Heflin and Buddy West Reasons to support this change are All of the ten most populous states allow their institutions to retain of their indirect costs except for Florida whose institutions retain and Texas whose universities get only UT Austin would gain an estimated million per year in additional revenue with this change This revenue could be used to expand UTs research capabilities by supporting faculty providing seed money for new projects and purchasing researchrelated equipment Three recent reports recommend that Texas universities be allowed to retain of indirect cost funding These include reports from the Texas Higher Education Coordinating Board a special commission appointed by thenLieutenant Governor Rick Perry and Texas Comptroller of Public Accounts Carole Rylander PLEASE TAKE THE TIME TO SUPPORT YOUR UNIVERSITY BY CONTACTING LEGISLATORS
